w:r.w:t: Squadron 42 Community Bot – User Guide
This guide explains how to use the Squadron 42 Community Bot. Each section summarises what the bot automates, which slash commands configure the feature, and what permissions you need.
Getting Started
• Invite the bot with both applications.commands and bot scopes, and grant Manage Channels, Manage Roles, message content, and Read Message History permissions.
• Slash commands register when the bot boots. If a command is missing, verify permission to manage commands and restart the bot.
Configuration Status
Command: /config-status (Administrator)

Posts an embed summarising ticket lobbies, voice templates, Spectrum watcher settings, embed upload allow-list, referral pool stats, org promotion forums, and moderation automation. Run this first when validating a deployment.
Ticket System
Commands: /ticket set-channel, /ticket set-archive, /ticket roles add|remove|list (Manage Guild)
Members click the ticket lobby embed to create a private channel with staff. Closing a ticket archives the channel into the configured category.
Dynamic Voice Rooms
Commands: /voice-rooms set-template, /voice-rooms clear-template, /voice-rooms list (Administrator)
Designate lobby voice channels that spawn personal rooms when joined. Empty rooms are deleted automatically.
Embed Template Uploader
Commands: /embed-access add|remove|list (Manage Server)

Upload a .txt/.md file that follows the Embed Template Instructions. Allow-listed roles have their templates rendered as embeds; plain text without template markers is reposted as normal messages. Users without access have their upload removed and receive a direct message explaining the policy.
Referral Pool
Commands: /register-referral-code, /get-referral-code (Everyone)
Stores and distributes STAR referral codes. Messages containing raw codes are removed and the user is reminded to use the slash commands.
Moderation Suite and Org Monitoring

Commands: /mod roles add|remove|list, /mod auto-ban set|clear|status, /mod org-promos add|remove|list; context actions Warn, Kick, Ban, Timeout, View History; /pardon (Manage Guild/Administrator as appropriate).

The bot routes slash and context commands through dedicated handlers. Auto-ban traps ban users when a trap role is applied. Org promotion enforcement deletes links posted outside authorised forums, prunes empty threads, and prevents duplicates. Referral/org monitoring runs on every message to keep channels compliant.
Spectrum Watcher
Commands: /spectrum set-channel, /spectrum set-forum, /spectrum status, /spectrum clear, /spectrum post-latest (Manage Guild)
Polls a configured RSI Spectrum forum and posts new threads into the chosen Discord channel. /spectrum post-latest forces a manual repost.
Troubleshooting Checklist
• Missing commands: restart the bot after confirming it can manage slash commands.
• Ticket lobby not responding: rerun /ticket set-channel and check the bot can create channels.
• Voice rooms persisting: confirm the lobby is still configured and the bot can manage channels.
• Spectrum posts absent: run /spectrum status, then rerun set commands if needed.
• Template upload rejected: have an admin run /embed-access add <role> for your role.
Support
Contact a server administrator or consult the Squadron 42 Bot repository for updates and support.
